title: Events in Baltimore Reflect a ‘Slow-Rolling Crisis’ Across U.S., Obama Says
description: Mr. Obama called for transparency and accountability in a federal investigation into the death of Freddie Gray, while also denouncing the violence in Baltimore.

title: Gay Marriage Arguments Divide Supreme Court Justices
description: The justice believed to hold the controlling vote, Anthony M. Kennedy, appeared torn about what to do in a ground-breaking civil rights case

title: N.F.L.’s League Office to Drop Its Tax-Exempt Status
description: As a result, the league will no longer have to publicly disclose its I.R.S. returns, which include the salaries of top executives like Commissioner Roger Goodell.

title: Fearing for Families After Nepal Quake, Thousands Return to Isolated Villages
description: Across the countryside outside Katmandu, people are making desperate journeys, anxious to find out what happened to their relatives and homes in the quake.

title: Baltimore Residents Begin Clearing Debris After Night of Riots
description: After surveying riot-scarred parts of Baltimore, Gov. Larry Hogan said there would be a much heavier presence from the police and the National Guard on Tuesday.

title: Latest News: Baltimore Riots, Same-Sex Marriage, State Dinner
description: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

title: Iran Takes Control of Cargo Ship; U.S. Sends Destroyer to Persian Gulf
description: A Pentagon official said that the ship, the Maersk Tigris, was intercepted by Iranian patrol boats while traveling through the Strait of Hormuz.

title: Life Term for Captain in South Korea Ferry Disaster
description: Lee Jun-seok was convicted of murder through willful negligence by a South Korean judge for his role in the sinking of the Sewol last April.

title: Latest Updates
description: Analysis and updates from the Supreme Court arguments on a constitutional right to gay marriage.

title: Frustration Grows in Nepal as Earthquake Relief Trickles In
description: The government has established 16 large camps in Katmandu, but many residents accuse officials of incompetence, neglect or even corruption.

title: Fatal Shooting Outside Brooklyn Church Was Set Off by Longtime Dispute, Police Say
description: A law enforcement official said that lingering ill will played a role in instigating the gun battle, with at least 15 shots fired, outside a church on Flatbush Avenue.

title: City Room: New York Today: Encyclopedia Bodega
description: Tuesday: Bodega masterpieces, breezy weather and Hudson River life forms.

title: First Draft: Today in Politics: Baltimore Riots and Same-Sex Marriage Share Center Stage
description: The country is waking to an extraordinary split-screen reality, as oral arguments in the landmark Supreme Court case on same-sex marriage are juxtaposing with the riots raging in Baltimore.

title: Alexis Tsipras, Greek Premier, Signals Possible Referendum Vote on Credit Deal
description: The prime minister said that if a plan fell outside his government’s mandate, “then the Greek people will have to give the answer.”

title: Indonesia Moves to Execute 9 Drug Convicts, Despite Pleas for Clemency
description: The prisoners, including eight foreigners, will face separate police firing squads in what is believed to be the largest mass execution in the country in decades.

title: ‘American in Paris’ and ‘Fun Home’ Get Most Tony Nods
description: The New York Times is covering the nominations for the 69th Tony Awards on Tuesday morning. The awards will be presented at Radio City Music Hall on June 7.

title: Lining Up, Early, for Same-Sex Marriage Arguments at Supreme Court
description: Same-sex marriage proponents traveled from near and far to be in Washington for the start of oral arguments before Supreme Court justices on Tuesday.

title: Debate That Divides: Why a Ruling for Same-Sex Marriage Would Help Republicans
description: It would allow the party to abandon an increasingly unpopular position without seeming to compromise on principle.

title: Wang Jianlin, a Billionaire at the Intersection of Business and Power in China
description: Relatives of some of China’s most powerful politicians and their business associates own significant stakes in companies of Wang Jianlin, Asia’s richest man.

title: Scenes From the Unrest in Baltimore
description: A turbulent day in Baltimore ended with rioting by rock-throwing youths and a call to end the violence by religious leaders and the mother of Freddie Gray.
